resources.string: Android implementation of the KeePass password manager
Idle time before locking the database
A file manager that accepts the ACTION_CREATE_DOCUMENT and ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT intent action is required to create, open, and save database files.
Some devices won\'t let apps use the clipboard.
Duration of storage in the clipboard (if supported by your device)
KeePassDX © %1$d Kunzisoft is open source and without advertising. \nIt is provided as is, under GPLv3 license, without any warranty.
No user data is retrieved, this application does not connect to any server, works only locally and fully respects the privacy of users.
In order to keep our freedom, fix bugs, add features and to be always active, we count on your contribution.
The Arcfour stream cipher is not supported.
Could not handle this URI in KeePassDX.
Make sure the path is correct.
This word is reserved and cannot be used.
No memory to load your entire database.
Could not load the key. Try to lower the KDF \"Memory Usage\".
At least one password generation type must be selected.
At least one credential must be set.
Each string must have a field name.
Enter a positive integer number in the \"Length\" field.
You cannot move a group here.
You cannot move an entry here.
You cannot copy an entry here.
You cannot copy a group here.
Unable to create database with this password and keyfile.
Secret key must be in Base32 format.
Period must be between %1$d and %2$d seconds.
The existing OTP type is not recognized by this form, its validation may no longer correctly generate the token.
This text does not match the requested item.
Saving a new item is not allowed in a read-only database
Unable to properly rebuild the list.
The file you are trying to upload is too big.
An error occurred while uploading the file data.
An error occurred while removing the file data.
An error occurred while performing an action on the database.
Unable to get the response from the challenge.
Unable to merge from a database V1.
Database location is unknown, database action cannot be performed.
Could not find file. Try reopening it from your file browser.
%1$s with the same UUID %2$s already exists.
Could not recognize the database format.
Displays OTP tokens in the list of entries
Displays the UUID linked to an entry or a group
Displays the number of entries in a group
Text size in the element list
Install a web browser to open this URL.
Request a search when opening a database
Search web domains with subdomains constraints
Depending on your file manager, KeePassDX may not allowed to write in your storage.
Solve problem by generating new UUIDs for duplicates to continue?
Keeps track of where databases are stored
Keeps track of where keyfiles are stored
Keeps track of the hardware keys used
Hide broken links in the list of recent databases
Select a file to import app settings
Create a file to export app settings
KeePassDX properties to manage app settings
Database encryption algorithm used for all data
To generate the key for the encryption algorithm, the master key is transformed using a randomly salted key derivation function.
Additional encryption rounds provide higher protection against brute force attacks, but can really slow down loading and saving.
Amount of memory to be used by the key derivation function.
Degree of parallelism (i.e. number of threads) used by the key derivation function.
Avoid password characters outside of text encoding format in database file (unrecognized chars are converted to the same letter).
Grant file write access to save database changes
Access to the file revoked by the file manager
A database is already open, close it first to open the new one
Permanently delete all nodes from the recycle bin?
A KeePass database is supposed to contain only small utility files (such as PGP key files).\n\nYour database may get very large and reduce performance with this upload.
Uploading this file will replace the existing one.
Removing unlinked data may decrease the size of your database but may also delete data used for KeePass plugins.
It is not recommended to add an empty keyfile.
The content of the keyfile should never be changed, and in the best case, should contain randomly generated data.
The information contained in your database file has been modified outside the app.
Merge the data, overwrite the external modifications by saving the database or reload it with the latest changes.
Reload the database with the latest changes.
Reloading the database will delete the locally modified data.
Access to the file revoked by the file manager, close the database and reopen it from its location.
You have not allowed the app to use an exact alarm. As a result, the features requiring a timer will not be done with an exact time.
The hash of the file is not guaranteed because Android can change its data on the fly. Change the file extension to .bin for correct integrity.

The notification permission allows you to display the status of the database and lock it with an easily accessible button.\n\nIf you do not activate this permission, the database open in the background will not be visible if another application is in the foreground.
The notification permission is needed to use the clipboard notification feature.
No biometric or device credential is enrolled.
The keystore is not properly initialized.
You still need to remember your vault main credential if you use device unlock recognition.
Extract database credential with device unlock data
Cannot read the device unlock key. Please delete it and repeat the unlock recognition procedure.
Could not recognize device unlock print
Unable to initialize device unlock prompt.
Type in the password, and then click this button.
Enable autofilling to quickly fill out forms in other apps
Sets default size of the generated passwords
Copy entry fields using the clipboard of your device
Show clipboard notifications to copy fields when viewing an entry
If automatic deletion of clipboard fails, delete its history manually.
Lock the database after a few seconds once the screen is off
Lock the database when the user clicks the back button on the root screen
Displays the lock button in the user interface
Tap to delete device unlocking keys
Use device unlocking to open a database more easily
Lets you scan your biometric to open the database
Lets you use your device credential to open the database
Automatically request device unlock if the database is set up to use it
Do not store any encrypted content to use device unlocking
Duration of device unlocking usage before deleting its content
Delete all encryption keys related to device unlock recognition
Delete all encryption keys related to device unlock recognition?

This feature will store encrypted credential data in the secure KeyStore of your device.

Depending on the native API implementation of the operating system, it may not be fully functional.

Check the compatibility and security of the KeyStore with the manufacturer of your device and the creator of the ROM you are using.
The device is running Android %1$s, but needs %2$s or later.
Could not find the corresponding hardware.
Data compression reduces the size of the database
Removes attachments contained in the database but not linked to an entry
Moves groups and entries to \"Recycle bin\" group before deleting
Use dynamic templates to fill in the fields of an entry
Limit the number of history items per entry
Limit the history size per entry
Require changing the master key the next time (once)
Change font used in fields for better character visibility
Allow copying the entry password and protected fields to the clipboard
Warning: The clipboard is shared by all apps. If sensitive data is copied, other software may recover it.
Lock the database when the clipboard duration expires or the notification is closed after you start using it
Activate a custom keyboard populating your passwords and all identity fields
When viewing an entry in KeePassDX, populate Magikeyboard with that entry
Show a notification when an entry is available
Try to save shared information when making a manual entry selection for easier future uses
Close the database when closing the notification
Timeout to clear the keyboard entry
\"Go\" key action after pressing a \"Field\" key
Automatically switch back to the previous keyboard on the database credentials screen
Automatically switch back to the previous keyboard on the search screen
Automatically switch back to the previous keyboard after executing \"Auto key action\"
Automatically switch back to the previous keyboard after locking the database
Close the database after an autofill selection
Attempt to display autofill suggestions directly from a compatible keyboard
Display option to let the user select database entry
Try to save search information when making a manual entry selection for easier future uses
Ask for saving data when filling of a form is completed
Blocklist that prevents auto filling of apps
Blocklist that prevents auto filling of web domains
Restart the app containing the form to activate the blocking.
Data save is not allowed for a database opened as read-only.
Allows tapping the \"Open\" button if no credentials are selected
Deletes the password entered after a connection attempt to a database
Open the database read-only by default
Save the database after every important action (in \"Modifiable\" mode)
Keep the screen on when watching or editing an entry
Allow third party apps to record or take screenshots of the app
Highlight elements to learn how the app works
Create your first password management file.
Open your earlier database file from your file browser to continue using it.
Entries help manage your digital identities.\n\nGroups (~folders) organize entries in your database.
Enter title, username or content of other fields to retrieve your passwords.
Link your password to your scanned biometric or device credential to quickly unlock your database.
Edit your entry with custom fields. Pool data can be referenced between different entry fields.
Generate a strong password to associate with your entry, easily define it according to the criteria of the form and don\'t forget secure password.
Remember to validate your entry and save your database.\n\nIf an automatic lock is activated and you forget you were making a modification, you risk losing your data.
Register an additional field, add a value and optionally protect it.
Upload an attachment to your entry to save important external data.
Set up one-time password management (HOTP / TOTP) to generate a token requested for two-factor authentication (2FA).
Enter the password and/or keyfile to unlock your database.\n\nBackup your database file in a safe place after each change.

Change opening mode for the session. 
 
"Write-protected" prevents unintended changes to the database. 
"Modifiable" lets you add, delete, or modify all the elements as you wish.
Copied fields can be pasted anywhere.\n\nUse the form filling method you prefer.
Lock your database quickly, you can set up the app to lock it after a while, and when the screen turns off.
Choose how entries and groups are sorted.
Help increase the stability, security and in adding more features.
Unlike many password management apps, this one is ad-free, copylefted libre software and does not collect personal data on its servers, no matter what version you use.
By buying the pro version, you will have access to this visual style and you will especially help the realization of community projects.
This visual style is available thanks to your generosity.
In order to keep our freedom and to always be active, we count on your contribution.
This feature is under development and requires your contribution to be available soon.
you are encouraging developers to create new features and to fix bugs according to your remarks.
Thanks a lot for your contribution.
We are working hard to release this feature quickly.
Remember to keep your app up to date by installing new versions.
At least one character from each
Icon pack used in the app
Displays foreground and background colors for an entry
